intro: Cacalia chola, commonly known as the purple false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are bright purple to pink in color. Cacalia chola is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
